intro: Teclea hanangensis var. unifoliolata, commonly known as the single leaf teclea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a single leaflet per leaf, distinguishing it from other varieties of Teclea. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
